title: How to Make Oreo Cupcakes

steps.headline: Preheat your oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit or 176.6 degrees Celsius.
Place three muffin or cupcake tin on your cooking space.
steps.description: Line 27 cupcake tins into each hole.

steps.headline: Whisk all the dry ingredients (except for the smashed Oreos) into a large bowl.
steps.description: Stir mixture round and round, making sure the ingredients have been blended together.

steps.headline: While whisking add the oil, sour cream, eggs, and vanilla extract.
steps.description: Whisk again, but a bit harder to beat the eggs well. If needed, use a hand blender to give the mix a better stir.

steps.headline: Slowly pour boiling water or brewed coffee.
steps.description: This time, you may need a hand blender or even an electric mixer. Start blending on medium speed, mixing round and round to make cupcake batter creamy. Keep blending for about thirty seconds. Add crushed Oreos. Set batter aside.

steps.headline: Add cupcake batter in cupcake tin.
steps.description: Use an ice cream scoop to pour batter into each tin. You should fill it about halfway up.

steps.headline: Bake the cupcakes.
steps.description: Bake the cupcakes for about 15-20 minutes or until cupcakes start to puff up and poking a toothpick inside comes out clean.

steps.headline: Set cupcakes aside to cool on a wire rack or plate.
Pour milk in a saucepan, sprinkling on top flour.
steps.description: Place your stove on low heat and keep whisking with a metal whisk.

steps.headline: Keep stirring.
steps.description: Keep stirring the mixture until it starts turning thick and rolling up. Once done, shut stove off and refrigerate frosting for thirty minutes.

steps.headline: In a separate bowl, blend the butter and Crisco together.
Pour refrigerated flour mixture into mix.
steps.description: Stir on medium speed and then add vanilla extract.

steps.headline: Stir in sugar and keep blending until creamy.
Blend in crushed Oreos on medium speed.
steps.description: Blend until Oreos are blended into the mixture. Set icing aside. If desired, you may add the cocoa powder now to blend frosting.

steps.headline: Scoop frosting into an ice cream scoop.
If wanted, chop a couple of Oreos for a topping.
steps.description: Sprinkle on top of cupcakes. Add one Oreo on top of each cupcake for another topping.

text: Making the Cupcakes Preheat your oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit or 176.6 degrees Celsius.  Place three muffin or cupcake tin on your cooking space. Line 27 cupcake tins into each hole. Whisk all the dry ingredients (except for the smashed Oreos) into a large bowl. Stir mixture round and round, making sure the ingredients have been blended together. While whisking add the oil, sour cream, eggs, and vanilla extract. Whisk again, but a bit harder to beat the eggs well. If needed, use a hand blender to give the mix a better stir. Slowly pour boiling water or brewed coffee. This time, you may need a hand blender or even an electric mixer. Start blending on medium speed, mixing round and round to make cupcake batter creamy. Keep blending for about thirty seconds. Add crushed Oreos. Set batter aside. Add cupcake batter in cupcake tin. Use an ice cream scoop to pour batter into each tin. You should fill it about halfway up. Bake the cupcakes. Bake the cupcakes for about 15-20 minutes or until cupcakes start to puff up and poking a toothpick inside comes out clean. Set cupcakes aside to cool on a wire rack or plate.  Making the Frosting Pour milk in a saucepan, sprinkling on top flour. Place your stove on low heat and keep whisking with a metal whisk. Keep stirring. Keep stirring the mixture until it starts turning thick and rolling up. Once done, shut stove off and refrigerate frosting for thirty minutes. In a separate bowl, blend the butter and Crisco together.  Pour refrigerated flour mixture into mix. Stir on medium speed and then add vanilla extract. Stir in sugar and keep blending until creamy.  Blend in crushed Oreos on medium speed. Blend until Oreos are blended into the mixture. Set icing aside. If desired, you may add the cocoa powder now to blend frosting. Serving the Cupcakes Scoop frosting into an ice cream scoop. Spread it onto each cupcake. If wanted, chop a couple of Oreos for a topping. Sprinkle on top of cupcakes. Add one Oreo on top of each cupcake for another topping. Enjoy!
